meanings.definition: A piece of chain mail worn to protect the neck and shoulders.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore a camail to shield his neck and shoulders in battle.
meanings.sent2: She carefully fastened the camail around her neck before heading into combat.
meanings.sent3: The camail looked like a shiny necklace made of tiny metal rings.
meanings.sent4: The camail was a protective curtain of interlocking metal, like a shield for the neck.
meanings.sent5: The camail jingled softly as the knight moved, a comforting sound in the midst of danger.

meanings.sent1: The armorer will camail the knight before the jousting tournament.
meanings.sent2: They camail their soldiers with precision, ensuring every piece is secure.
meanings.sent3: I will camail you with the finest chain mail, fit for a noble warrior!
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith camailed the armor expertly, each link shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Camailing the troops was a crucial task before the impending battle, ensuring their safety.
